settings.title: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet amet
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet amet
How Big Mike, a Barbershop Painter, Broke Into the Art World
settings.text:
Michael âBig Mikeâ Saviello has been the manager at the iconic East Village barbershop, Astor Place Hairstylists, for nearly 40 years. His passion for art has been lifelong, but he never pursued formal training. With the responsibilities of college, business, marriage and family, art was far from his mind for many years.
Mike was inspired by a photo he took on a lunch date with his wife, realizing that this would be the perfect first portrait for him to return to painting. It was good fortune that Mike then found a large, high-quality canvas outside the barbershop. Since then, he has conscientiously made time, painting every day during his lunch break in the barbershopâs storage area, now transformed into his private gallery of over one hundred paintings. His style is influenced by impressionism and realism, as well as popular culture. Mike has been overwhelmed by the response to the paintings, which he made just for the joy of creating them, as shown in Heller Filmsâ (@NewYorkNico) Vimeo staff pick short âBig Mike Takes Lunchâ. His work is currently exhibited throughout New York City.
As a media personality, Mikeâs art has been featured on PIX11 News (WPIX) New York, NBC New York, Fox5 New York, The New York Times, and The Times of London to name a few. Big Mike was profiled on Humans of New York (Part I, Part II) in June 2021, which brought his story to a much larger audience, many of whom have reached out to him and further enriched his journey. @michaelsaviello is always happy to connect, especially on Instagram. Check out his latest work, merch and NFTs for sale.

Painting Chess sets Apparel others

settings.title: American Dream
settings.text: I had the idea of doing a painting based on Rembrandtâs: âThe Storm on the Sea of Galilee.â Then I thought I would do the painting with all the immigrants and refugees through the ages that came to this country, illustrating the hardships they faced in getting here. I wanted to tell their story through a painting. The storm at sea is a metaphor for all the hardships and obstacles they faced in coming to America, fleeing oppression, and following the dream of freedom and a better life. Also, the painting includes the Statue Of Liberty, welcoming all to freedom.
